awd_titl_txt: Mixed Gas Transport Through Polymeric Materials             and Composites
awd_abstract_narration: Research in this project will focus on the fabrication and                      evaluation of a new apparatus to assess gas permeabilities                      through membranes and composite membranes.  A novel gas                         sampling system and automation of the equipment are to be                       examined as a means of providing high precision data of                         molecular transport with temporal resolution on the order of                    seconds.  Planned tests include study of metal-ceramic,                         polymer-ceramic and polymer blend membranes.                                                                                                                    Membrane separation processes are economical, energy-efficient                  methods which help to make American industry more competitive                   and environmentally responsible.  Development and                               characteristics of new membranes for gas separations can                        impact processing in the fuel industry, environmental efforts                   to control volatile organic compounds or greenhouse gases, and                  air fractionation for hospital oxygen supplies.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
